Package net.minecraftforge.client.event

Class ClientChatReceivedEvent

java.lang.Object
net.minecraftforge.eventbus.api.Event
net.minecraftforge.client.event.ClientChatReceivedEvent
public class ClientChatReceivedEvent
extends net.minecraftforge.eventbus.api.Event

Fired when the client has received a chat message or command to the server. This can be used to modify or prevent messages from being displayed to the player.

This event is cancellable, and does not have a result. If the event is cancelled, the chat message or command will not displayed to the player.

This event is fired on the main Forge event bus, only on the logical client.

See Also:
ForgeEventFactory.onClientChat(ChatType, ITextComponent, UUID)

  • Method Details

    • getMessage

      public net.minecraft.util.text.ITextComponent getMessage()

      Returns the message that will be displayed in the chat message window, if the event is not cancelled. If the message is blank, then no message will be displayed.

      Returns:
      The message that will be displayed in the chat message window

    • setMessage

      public void setMessage​(net.minecraft.util.text.ITextComponent message)

      Sets the new message to be displayed in the chat message window, if the event is not cancelled.

      If message is null, then no message will be displayed.

      Parameters:
      message - The new message to be displayed, can be null

    • getType

      public net.minecraft.util.text.ChatType getType()

      Returns the type of the message, as defined by ChatType.

      Returns:
      The type of the message

    • getSenderUUID

      @Nullable public UUID getSenderUUID()

      Returns the UUID of the sender of the message, or null if one is not specified.

      Returns:
      The UUID of the message's sender, or null
